title: User Authentication and Security Framework
summary: Implement secure user login with multi-factor authentication and data protection measures.
description: Develop a robust authentication module that allows customers to log in using secure credentials with multi-factor authentication. Implement encryption standards, session management, and activity logging to ensure customer data security. This framework will serve as the foundation for all portal transactions and user access to sensitive banking functions.

title: Responsive Portal Design and User Interface
summary: Design and build a modern responsive interface for desktop, tablet, and mobile users.
description: Create a responsive, user-centric interface that delivers a consistent banking experience across multiple devices. The interface should emphasize intuitive navigation, accessibility, and visual clarity. Incorporate design principles that reduce user effort, ensuring streamlined workflows and high user satisfaction across all supported screens.

title: Personalized User Dashboard
summary: Develop a dashboard that displays products, services, and key user information.
description: Build a personalized dashboard that dynamically populates banking products, account balances, and relevant services based on user profile and eligibility. The dashboard should allow users to quickly access key features, display notifications, and serve as the primary control center for managing all interactions within the self-service portal.

title: Account Opening and Service Requests Workflow
summary: Enable submission and tracking of account openings and service modifications.
description: Implement process-driven workflows that allow users to submit account opening requests, product applications, and service modification requests directly within the portal. The workflows should feature guided steps with minimal clicks and integrated validation, ensuring efficiency and compliance with banking regulations.

title: Real-Time Notifications and Status Tracking
summary: Provide live updates and notifications for user-initiated requests.
description: Design and deploy an event-driven system that provides real-time status updates and automatic email notifications for user-submitted requests. This feature should integrate with internal banking systems to relay accurate and timely updates, keeping users informed at each stage of their request lifecycle.

title: Document Management and Upload Capability
summary: Allow users to upload, store, and retrieve supporting documents.
description: Develop a secure document upload feature that supports common file formats, encrypts files during transmission and storage, and validates document authenticity. Ensure uploaded documents are associated with relevant user requests and accessible for review throughout workflow processes.

title: Session Management and Application Persistence
summary: Enable saving of incomplete applications for future completion.
description: Introduce a session management system that allows users to save their progress on incomplete account or service applications and resume them later. The system should auto-save progress, restore previous states upon login, and ensure data integrity and privacy during interrupted workflows.

title: Core Banking System Integration
summary: Integrate the self-service portal with existing core banking systems.
description: Develop integration services between the new portal and the bankâ€™s core banking system to enable secure exchange of data related to accounts, transactions, and user profiles. The integration layer must be optimized for reliability, data synchronization, and failover mechanisms to ensure uninterrupted service availability.

title: Role-Based Access Control Implementation
summary: Enforce user authorization and access restrictions based on roles.
description: Establish a role-based access control mechanism ensuring users can only access information and perform actions appropriate to their identity and authorization level. Define roles, permissions, and access hierarchies to maintain security and compliance requirements consistent with banking standards.

title: Audit Trails and Interaction History
summary: Maintain a comprehensive history of user interactions and requests.
description: Implement an auditing feature that records all user activities, including logins, form submissions, and request statuses. The history should be easily retrievable for the user and compliant with regulatory data retention standards, enhancing transparency, user trust, and internal traceability.
